results.title: Souvenirs from Sweden
results.creator_credit: Henning Carlsen, Svenska filminstitutet and Svensk Filmindustri
results.brief_description: An unconventional picture of modern Sweden, its people and its natural beauty. Sailing in the archipelago, glass-blowing at Orrefors, the Vasa skiing race, the Nobel Festival - the everyday life of Swedes and their special occasions. (Awards: Grand Prize of the Annual International Travel Film Festival)

results.title: Southward ho!: in New Zealand's beautiful South Island
results.brief_description: A travelogue of the South Island showing Queen Charlotte Sound, fishing and picnics, Nelson City and car services to west coast, lakes, glaciers, ferns, Franz Josef Glacier, Christchurch, River Avon, Canterbury College, Lyttleton (port of Christchurch and southern terminus for express steamer service) and much more.

results.title: Southeast Asia: Vietnam, Cambodia, Laos
results.brief_description: Although the people of North and South Vietnam, Cambodia and Laos are similar, there are differences in human use of the land. The rugged terrain of Laos is less productive than Cambodia’s fertile plain. The North Vietnamese have developed more industry than their South Vietnamese neighbours, although both countries are similar geographically.

results.title: Southeast Asia: Malaysia and Singapore
results.brief_description: Most of the people in Malaysia are farmers, fishermen or miners. Most of the people of Singapore are merchants, importers and exporters, or factory workers. In both countries most of the people are Malay, Chinese, Indian and Pakistani. But in spite of the ethnic similarities, Malaysia and Singapore are strikingly different.

results.title: Southeast Asia: Burma and Thailand
results.brief_description: Burma and Thailand are similar in their geography and in the ways of life of their people. Old traditions guide much of the life of the people of both countries. However, both Rangoon and Bangkok are modern-looking. This film examines the similarities of the two countries.

results.title: South Pacific island children: life in Fiji
results.brief_description: Family life on one of the largest islands of the Fiji Group. Shows members of a native family at a variety of daily activities - fishing, gardening, attending school and constructing a house. Also indicates the importance of the coconut palm to the islanders and shows a fish drive followed by a feast.

results.title: South of the Border
results.brief_description: Music is an important part of the lives of Latin Americans, closely linked to the expression of their personal and political feelings, hopes and aspirations. In Central America, where the press is censored, and the radio and TV gagged; the U.S.-backed regimes have failed to stop the music. Although the penalties for singing the wrong song can be jail or death, the music goes on. This video is a powerful musical tour which starts in Cuba, and moves to Mexico, Guatemala, Honduras and El Salvador. Narrated by Midnight Oil’s Peter Garrett, the film is a moving testament to the bravery and courage of those who pursue freedom.

results.title: South Mysore
results.creator_credit: AMA and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: An American family holidaying in Bangalor and the surrounding district. The tourist facilities; Mysore City; the palaces, markets and temples; street entertainers, formal gardens, festivals, visits to game reserves; the Jain monuments; local customs and folk dances.
